name: Cabinet (one of a pair)
description: Cabinet (one of a pair); Attributed to Adam Weisweiler (French, 1744 - 1820, master 1778); Paris, France; about 1785; pietra dura plaque mid-17th - late 18th century; Oak, pine, and beech veneered with ebony and mahogany; pewter stringing; set with pietra dure plaques and micromosaic roundels; gilt-bronze mounts; portor d'Italie marble tops; 101.6 x 150.2 x 53 cm (40 x 59 1/8 x 20 7/8 in.); 76.DA.9.1; J. Paul Getty Museum, Los Angeles, California
title: Cabinet (one of a pair)
medium: Oak, pine, and beech veneered with ebony and mahogany; pewter stringing; set with pietra dure plaques and micromosaic roundels; gilt-bronze mounts; portor d'Italie marble tops
